CXR , diuresis with IV medications , EKG , R/O MI , Abdo CT
HPI: Pt is a 75F with a h/o CHF/CAD , A-fib , lung CA s/p R wedge
resection. She has been admitted 5-6 times this year for CHF
exacerbation. She was in her USOH when over the last 6 days she has
noticed a 6lb weight gain. Additionally , pt experienced increasing SOB ,
and required more pillows to sleep. She uses 2 pills at baseline. Her
SOB/orthopnea worsened to the point when on the night before admission ,
she was unable to fall asleep even when almost sitting up. Per her PCP's
instructions , pt took Metolazone 2.5mg and Torsamide 40mg x1 which did
not increase her UOP. Pt also noticed a fever to 101 the night before
1-2 days. + L leg swelling for weeks , no CP , no N/V/D , no pyuria , no
Vitals in ED: T98.6 P72 BP121/65 RR18 SaO2 on 2L:98%
Pt recieved O2 and 40 Lasix IV in the ED.
PMH: CRI , hypothyroidism , paroxysmal a-fib , DM , CHF , CAD , lung CA s/p
R wedge resection , basal cell CA on lip s/p resection , uterine CA s/p
Social: Lives with husband across street from CCH .  +tob history ,
PE on admit: VS:T: 97.6 P77 BP:NR RR20 SaO2100% on
2L C/V irreg irreg , no m/g/r. Lungs crackles at L base , faint crackles
at R base. Legs trace edema but equal. No redness , +tenderness on L shin
CXR: Small L effusion , +mild pulm edema.
A/P: 75F with h/o CAD/CHF/lung CA/Afib with 6 days of weight gain ,
worsening SOB and PND , with borderline elevated WBC and dysuria.
+I- Pt was R/OMI'ed with all three sets negative for ischemia. This was
to examine for causes of CHF exacerbation. Pt was continued on her home
overloaded given CXR , physical exam , and HPI. Pt was diuresed with IV
Lasix in the ED. On the floor she received 2.5mg of Metolazone followed
by 60mg of Torsemide. She was then diuresed with 5mg of Metolazone
followed by 120mg of Torsemide. She was roughly negative 1.3L. Pt was
doing clinically well when on 1/16 pt's Cr increased to 3.2 from her
baseline of about 2.5. At that time Torsemide and Metolazone were held.
Pt's daily weights continued to decrease even off of diuretics. On 2/22 ,
however pt's weight increased to 72.9 kg from 70.6kg. At this time pt was
restarted on her home rx of torsemide 20mg po bid. A repeat weight was
checked in the pm returning as 71.7kg. Pt was discharged on 2/22 at a
of discharge pt was at or better than her baseline function in terms
+R- During her stay the patient remained in afib with good rate control
2 ) Heme: Pt was found to be supertheraputic during her stay. Her coumadin
was held throughout her admission as her INR remained 3.9 to 4.0 in the
discharge pt was started on 1/2 her home coumadin with VNA/PCP f/u in 2
days. Pt d/ced on Coumadin 1mg qpm.
3 ) ID- Pt had a negative UA and urine CTX. However during her admission pt
developed diarrhea. Because of concern for c.diff colitis. Pt recieved an
abdominal CT. CT showed no colitis but did show a LLL consolidation likely
PNA. Pt was initially treated with azithromycin but as her cough and o2
requirement did not improve , as well as because pt began to spike fevers ,
pt was begun on ceftaz and levo for gram pos coverage ( levo ) double gram
neg coverage , and atypical coverage ( levo ) for presumed hospital aquired

hydration. No episodes of volume overload. On ACEi for AL reduction.

POTASSIUM CHLORIDE IMMED. REL. ( KCL IMMEDIATE... )
*** LOW KCL REPLACEMENT SCALE ORAL PO Scale Frequency
1.Only KCL Immediate Release products may be used for KCL
2.Do not use sustained-release potassium for KCL scale
doses. 3.Replace KCL based on lab values.
4.As per SMH Potassium Chloride Policy: each 20 eq dose
is to be given with 4oz of fluid.
5.A serum creatinine must be ordered and checked daily
while patient is ordered for a K-scale.
6.K-scale cannot be used on patients with:
* A serum creatinine greater than or equal to 2.0 mg/dl
* A serum creatinine increase of 0.5 mg/dl within 24 hours.
* Hold scale and contact MD if SCr is greater than 2.0.
----------- If K+ Level is less than 3.1 then call H.O.
If K+ Level is 3.1-3.3 , then administer KCL 40 meq orally
meq orally 2 hours later. Recheck K+ Level 2 hours after
If K+ Level is 3.4-3.6 , then administer KCL 40 meq orally
Recheck K+ Level 2 hours after dose was given.
If K+ Level is 3.7-4.0 , then administer KCL 20 meq orally
Recheck K+ Level 2 hours after dose was given.
If K+ Level is 4.1-5.0 , then DO NOT administer KCL.
If K+ Level is greater than 5.0 then call H.O.

out.medication_name: Cardiac catheterization with stent to old CABG vessel
HPI: 58 yo female smoker with hx of CAD , s/p CABG x3 , DM II , HTN , and
hyperlipidemia admitted to the CCU after elective cardiac cath s/p
abnormal stress test. Cath showed impaired flow in the inferior
and posterolateral zones due to obstructive degenerative disease in
the SVGs to the RCA and LCF-OM. Stent placed in the RCA graft though
there was extensive calcification and difficulty
obtaining full stent expansion , and following the stent deployment
there was poor reflow accompanied by mild chest pain and EKG changes ,
without hemodynamic embarrassment. Pt was transferred back
to the CCU stable and without pain. Pt was scheduled for call out to
floor , but had an episode of jaw sensation , different from previous
angina. Pt was upset by turn of events , but was calmed by staff. Was
then evaluated by Dr. Demora and came out to the floor Seygo No Wood night.
DMII , HTN , Hyperlipidemia , Cirrhosis s/p CABG x 3
Meds in CCU ASA 325 mg qd
